issues.title: Missing Error Handling in `handle_client_request`
issues.description: The `handle_client_request` function lacks comprehensive error handling.  JSON decoding failures or other exceptions during processing could lead to silent failures or crashes.

issues.title: Potential for Data Loss due to Missing `try...except` blocks
issues.description: Several sections of the code (especially within the `run` method's main loop) are prone to unhandled exceptions which may lead to data corruption or loss. These sections should be wrapped in `try...except` blocks to gracefully handle potential errors.

issues.title: Inconsistent Error Responses
issues.description: Error responses to clients aren't consistently formatted. The function uses different error messages for different scenarios (e.g., 'List action must have a valid url', 'No workers available', 'Worker not available'). Standardizing the error format would improve consistency and debugging.

issues.title: Hardcoded Port Numbers
issues.description: The frontend and backend port numbers are hardcoded. It would be better to make these configurable through command-line arguments or configuration files for flexibility and better maintainability.

issues.title: Lack of Logging
issues.description: The code lacks proper logging. Adding logging statements would greatly aid in debugging and monitoring the broker's operation.

issues.title: Unclear Worker Heartbeat Mechanism
issues.description: The implementation of worker heartbeats is not explicit or documented. Clarifying how heartbeats are handled and what constitutes a 'dead' worker is necessary.

feedback: The code demonstrates a functional implementation of a hash ring-based message broker. However, it suffers from significant robustness issues due to inadequate error handling and potential for unhandled exceptions. Addressing these issues is crucial for reliable operation.  Minor improvements in configuration and logging would also enhance maintainability.
